tool.name: MACH imputation:

param.name: i
param.label: Genotype input for imputation? (From your current history)

param.name: hapspath
param.label: Reference haplotypes to impute from? (system available)
param.help: These are the currently installed MACH compatible haplotype source files for imputation

param.name: rounds
param.label: MACH stage 1 rounds. More is often better and always slower - 50 is generally recommended
param.help: Rounds are mcmc restarts - only really useful if you allow random reseeding

param.name: chrom
param.label: Chromosome (default is all)
param.help: Provide a chromosome to restrict to a regional MACH imputation run

param.name: offset
param.label: Start (offset in chromosome) for regional imputation
param.help: Offset to start of region to be imputed

param.name: length
param.label: Length of regional imputation
param.help: Length of region to be imputed

param.name: mask
param.label: Mask for testing imputation accuracy - use a small fraction - zero for production runs, 0.01 or so for testing
param.help: Mask will give an estimate of imputation accuracy by masking this fraction of input genotypes - see MACH docs please

param.name: stage1
param.help: Subsample to use for generating crossover and erate files - 300 max will be used
param.option: Founders only for stage 1 error/crossover estimation
Offspring only for stage 1 error/crossover estimation
All for stage 1 error/crossover estimation (beware, MACH freaks out with irregular family data)

param.name: nstage1
param.label: Number of individuals to use for MACH stage
param.help: 300 is typically recommended as enough for this stage - it takes much longer with more...

param.name: stage2
param.help: Subsample (or all) in input genotype sample to impute
param.option: Founders only for imputed output file
Offspring only for imputed output file
All subjects for imputed output file (messy trios will freak MACH out)
Nuclear affected trios (affected offspring preferred, no siblings)

param.name: rsq
param.label: Imputed markers with lower RSQ than this cutoff will be filtered from the final output map
param.help: An RSQ > 0.3 is recommended to filter out poor imputation - see MACH docs please

param.name: compact
param.label: Add --compact flag for MACH - not recommended at present

param.name: seed
param.label: Pseudorandom number stream seed (0=random integer)
param.help: Set this >0 ONLY if you know what you're doing and why - it can be useful but might (eg) violate inference assumptions

tests.test: python sgemach.py -b tinywga -c 22 -s 21784722 -l 123000 -r 1 -o temp -p ./test -1 fo -2 fo -a /share/shared/data/1000g/2010_06 --greedy

tool.help:
.. class:: warningmark
**If there are no genotype files in your history, you will not be able to select an input file for this tool**
.. class:: warningmark
**NOTE**
This is a tool that will run MACH on a genotype data set to impute genotypes from a set of reference haplotypes
.. class:: infomark
**Syntax**
- **Name** is the title to use for all output files in this run - **Input Data** is a genotype file (linkage format pedigree data) from your current history - **Chromosome** is the chromosome for a restricted (regional) imputation if desired - blank means impute entire input data region (eg WGA) - **Offset** is the offset within the chromosome to the first base of the desired region of a restricted imputation - **Length** is the length in bases of the desired region of a restricted imputation - **Reference Haplotypes** is your choice of reference haplotypes to impute from the system installed possibilities (set in tool-data/mach_haps.loc) - **stage1** allows restriction of MACH stage 1 to founders only (fo) or offspring only - **stage2** allows restriction of MACH stage 2 and thus the output to founders only (fo) or offspring only (oo) or nuclear trios - **Rounds** is the MACH rounds parameter - 50 may be suitable but please see the MACH documentation - **Greedy** controls use of the --greedy MACH parameter - please see the MACH documentation - **Compact** controls use of the --compact MACH parameter - please see the MACH documentation - NOT recommended for routine use
NOTE - plotting millions of p values may take tens of minutes depending on how busy the server is - be patient please.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Summary**
This genotype imputation tool relies on MACH software - please see http://genome.sph.umich.edu/wiki/Mach for details and documentation
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Explanation**
Imputation of non-genotyped markers using haplotype information from a reference sample is a popular method of gaining some power from commodity whole genome products. Power gains of 3% to 10% have variously been reported. Good luck.
-----
